page.title: 08ST LAWRENCE'S CHURCH,SLOUGH.
page.content: St Lawrences was the parish church of Upton, now a part of Slough but originally a separate village.It is one of the oldest churches in Slough.The original church was Saxon,this was replaced by a Norman stone building.The Tower and the nave still stand and Upton was mentioned in the Domesday Book. Local building material of flints and "pudding stones" was used and can still be seen. Sir William Herschel,the famous astronomer,was buried here in 1822, having discovered Uranus in 1781,and built the largest telescope of the time in 1789. Thomas Grey is said to be referring to St Lawrences in his"Elegy in a Country Churchyard" The church was fully restored in 1981.
